feedbacks.a: You can archive data in Amazon Glacier but it is not the most cost-effective if you do not have a retrieval time requirement, as it offers shorter data retrieving time but is more expensive.
feedbacks.b: Amazon Glacier Deep Archive is the most cost-effective option if you want to archive data and do not have a retrieval time requirement. You can retrieve data in 12 or 48 hours.
feedbacks.c: Amazon S3 Standard-Infrequent Access is not used for archiving data, but for less frequently accessed data.
feedbacks.d: Amazon S3 Intelligent Tiering is not used for archiving data, but for moving data between two access tiers based on changing access patterns.

questions.question: Which S3 Storage Class is the most cost-effective for archiving data with no retrieval time requirement?

feedbacks.a: Amazon S3 Lifecycle Rules can be used to define when S3 objects should be transitioned to another storage class or when objects should be deleted after some time. They are not used to lock policies from future edits.
feedbacks.b: S3 Object Lock is used to prevent an object from being deleted or overwritten for a fixed amount of time or indefinitely. This is not used to lock policies from future edits, but instead objects.
feedbacks.c: Amazon S3 Standard-Infrequent Access allows you to store infrequently accessed data, with rapid access when needed, has a high durability, and is stored in several Availability Zones to avoid data loss in case of a disaster. This is a storage class, not a S3 feature for locking policies from future edits.
feedbacks.d: S3 Glacier Vault Lock allows you to easily deploy and enforce compliance controls for individual S3 Glacier vaults with a vault lock policy. You can specify controls such as 'write once read many' (WORM) in a vault lock policy and lock the policy from future edits. Once locked, the policy can no longer be changed.

questions.question: Which S3 feature should you use if you want to make sure that a policy will no longer be changed?

related_lectures.title: S3 Glacier Vault Lock & S3 Object Lock

asset.title: S3 - S3 Object Lock and Glacier Vault Lock v2.mp4

feedbacks.a: EBS is an easy to use, high performance block storage service for EC2 instances.  but it does not allow on-premises servers to seamlessly use the AWS Cloud at the storage layer.
feedbacks.b: Snowball is used to move petabytes of data, not to allow on-premises servers to use the AWS Cloud at the storage level.
feedbacks.c: S3 is an AWS Cloud "infinitely" scaling object storage but does not allow on-premises servers to use the AWS Cloud at the storage layer.
feedbacks.d: AWS Storage Gateway is a hybrid cloud storage service that gives you on-premises access to virtually unlimited cloud storage.

questions.question: What hybrid AWS service is used to allow on-premises servers to seamlessly use the AWS Cloud at thestorage layer?

feedbacks.a: AWS Snowcone is a small, portable, rugged, and secure edge computing and data transfer device. It provides up to 8 TB of usable storage.
feedbacks.b: Snowball Edge is best-suited to move petabytes of data and offers computing capabilities. Be careful, it's recommended to use a fleet of Snowballs to move less than 10PBs of data. Over this quantity, it's better-suited to use Snowmobile.
feedbacks.c: Snowmobile is used to move exabytes of data in or out of AWS (1 EB=1,000PBs=1,000,000TBs). You should use Snowmobile if you'd like to move more than 10PBs of data.

questions.question: Which of the following services is a petabyte-scale data moving service (as a fleet) in or out of AWS with computing capabilities?

feedbacks.a: AWS Snowcone is a small, portable, rugged, and secure edge computing and data transfer device. It provides up to 8 TB of usable storage.
feedbacks.b: Snowball Edge is best-suited to move petabytes of data and offers computing capabilities.
feedbacks.c: Snowmobile is used to move exabytes of data in or out of AWS (1 EB=1,000 PBs=1,000,000 TBs).

questions.question: Which of the following is an exabytes-scale data moving service in or out of AWS?

feedbacks.a: The key is the full path to the object. Example: s3://my-bucket/my_folder1/another_folder/my_file.txt
feedbacks.b: Value is the content that you are storing. An object value can be any sequence of bytes.
feedbacks.c: Access Keys are used to sign programmatic requests to the AWS CLI or AWS API.
feedbacks.d: Metadata is a set of name-value pairs with which you can store information regarding the object.

questions.question: What are Objects NOT composed of?

feedbacks.a: You can create folders in Amazon S3 to organize your objects (visually), but objects are not stored in folders.
feedbacks.b: Buckets store objects in Amazon S3.
feedbacks.d: A bin is not used to store objects in S3.

questions.question: Where are objects stored in Amazon S3?

feedbacks.a: AWS Storage Gateway is a hybrid cloud storage service that gives you on-premises access to virtually unlimited cloud storage. It is not used to transfer data to the Cloud.
feedbacks.b: AWS Snowball Edge is an edge computing, data migration, and edge storage device that comes in two options: Snowball Edge Storage Optimized (80 TB of HDD capacity) and Snowball Edge Compute Optimized (42 TB of HDD capacity). Snowball Edge is not cost-optimized for this transfer and might not fit in the location.
feedbacks.c: AWS Snowcone is a small, portable, rugged, and secure edge computing and data transfer device. It provides up to 8 TB of usable storage.
feedbacks.d: AWS OpsHub for Snow Family is a user-friendly tool that you can use to manage your devices and local AWS services. It can be used to initiate the transfer from the Snow device, but cannot be used to be a transfer mean of its own.

questions.question: A research team deployed in a location with low-internet connection would like to move 5 TBs of data to the Cloud. Which service can it use?

feedbacks.a: A Scaling Policy is used to define how to scale the capacity of your Auto Scaling group in response to changing demand. It is not used to define actions to move S3 objects between different storage classes. S3 scales automatically and is advertised as an "infinite" storage
feedbacks.b: Bucket policies are JSON documents for granting permission to your Amazon S3 resources. It is not used to define actions to move S3 objects between different storage classes.
feedbacks.c: Lifecycle Rules can be used to define when S3 objects should be transitioned to another storage class or when objects should be deleted after some time.
feedbacks.d: Replication enables automatic, asynchronous copying of objects across Amazon S3 buckets, it is not used to define actions to move S3 objects between different storage classes.

questions.question: What can you use to define actions to move S3 objects between different storage classes?

feedbacks.a: Snowball Edge Storage Optimized devices are well suited for large-scale data migrations and recurring transfer workflows, as well as local computing with higher capacity needs.
feedbacks.b: Snowball Edge Compute Optimized provides powerful computing resources for higher performance workloads such as machine learning, full motion video analysis, analytics, and local computing stacks. Despite providing local computing capacity, AWS Snowball Edge Compute Optimized devices are not best-suited for data transfer, but instead the high performance workloads mentioned above.
feedbacks.c: AWS Snowcone is a small, portable, rugged, and secure edge computing and data transfer device. It provides up to 8 TB of usable storage. Despite proving local computing capacity, it is not best-suited for petabytes-scale transfers.
feedbacks.d: AWS Snowmobile is an exabyte-scale data transfer service used to move extremely large amounts of data to AWS. It is not cost-effective for regular transfers of petabytes of data and does not provide local computing capacity.

questions.question: A non-profit organization needs to regularly transfer petabytes of data to the cloud and to have access to local computing capacity. Which service can help with this task?

feedbacks.a: Amazon S3 Standard - General Purpose is used for frequently accessed data, not infrequently accessed data.
feedbacks.b: Amazon Glacier is used to archive data, but requires time before retrieving data.
feedbacks.c: Amazon S3 One Zone-Infrequent Access is suitable for infrequently accessed data with rapid access when needed, but because data is stored in one Availability Zone, data is lost in case of disaster.
feedbacks.d: Amazon S3 Standard-Infrequent Access allow you to store infrequently accessed data, with rapid access when needed, has a high durability, and is stored in several Availability Zones to avoid data loss in case of a disaster. It can be used to store data for disaster recovery, backups, etc.

questions.question: Which S3 Storage Class is suitable for less frequently accessed data, but with rapid access when needed, while keeping a high durability and allowing an Availability Zone failure?
